vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-nested-if
vulnerability_findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-decrement-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix decrement expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix decrement expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: uninitialized-state
vulnerability_findings.message: EternalStorage._owner (RandomAuRaMock.sol#55) is never initialized. It is used in:

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in RandomAuRa.commitHash (RandomAuRaMock.sol#298-309):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(commitHashCallable(miningAddress,_secretHash)) (RandomAuRaMock.sol#301)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- bytes32Storage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#306)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound (RandomAuRaMock.sol#344-399):
	External calls:
	- stakingContract = validatorSetContract().stakingContract() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#353)
	- stakingEpoch = IStaking(stakingContract).stakingEpoch() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#355)
	- applyBlock = validatorSetContract().validatorSetApplyBlock() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#356)
	- endBlock = IStakingAuRa(stakingContract).stakingEpochEndBlock() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#357)
	- validators = validatorSetContract().getValidators() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#363)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- uintStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#367)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in RandomAuRa.revealSecret (RandomAuRaMock.sol#315-323):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(revealSecretCallable(miningAddress,_secret)) (RandomAuRaMock.sol#318)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- boolStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#322)
	- uintStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#321)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in RandomAuRa.commitHash (RandomAuRaMock.sol#298-309):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(commitHashCallable(miningAddress,_secretHash)) (RandomAuRaMock.sol#301)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- addressArrayStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#308)
	- bytesStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#307)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound (RandomAuRaMock.sol#344-399):
	External calls:
	- stakingContract = validatorSetContract().stakingContract() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#353)
	- stakingEpoch = IStaking(stakingContract).stakingEpoch() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#355)
	- applyBlock = validatorSetContract().validatorSetApplyBlock() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#356)
	- endBlock = IStakingAuRa(stakingContract).stakingEpochEndBlock() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#357)
	- validators = validatorSetContract().getValidators() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#363)
	- maxRevealSkipsAllowed = IStakingAuRa(stakingContract).stakeWithdrawDisallowPeriod() / collectRoundLength() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#374-375)
	- validators = validatorSetContract().getValidators() (RandomAuRaMock.sol#384)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- bytesStorage (RandomAuRaMock.sol#398)

vulnerability_findings.name: constable-states
vulnerability_findings.message: EternalStorage._owner should be constant (RandomAuRaMock.sol#55)

function getCipher(uint256 _collectRound, address _miningAddress) public view returns(bytes memory) {

        return bytesStorage[keccak256(abi.encode(CIPHERS, _collectRound, _miningAddress))];
vulnerability_findings.message: RandomAuRa.getCipher (RandomAuRaMock.sol#422-424) should be declared external

errors: exception (RuntimeError: Source map error, unknown name(SHR) or instr_name(INVALID))

vulnerability_findings.name: Dependence on predictable environment variable (SWC 120)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A control flow decision is made based on The block.number environment variable.
The block.number environment variable is used to determine a control flow decision. Note that the values of variables like coinbase, gaslimit, block number and timestamp are predictable and can be manipulated by a malicious miner. Also keep in mind that attackers know hashes of earlier blocks. Don't use any of those environment variables as sources of randomness and be aware that use of these variables introduces a certain level of trust into miners.
Classification: SWC-120

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110
